description: Concatenation of 'prevprime(n) and n and prevprime(n)' is a prime.
example: n=222 -> previous prime is 211, thus '211222211' is a prime.
mathematica: okQ[n_] := Module[{idppn=IntegerDigits[NextPrime[n,-1]]}, PrimeQ[FromDigits[Join[idppn, IntegerDigits[n], idppn]]]]; Select[Range[350], okQ] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jan 07 2011 *)
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Oct 15 1998.
